website_summaries.verdict: A well-made six-sided fidget cube that's designed with preschoolers in mind.
pros: Designed by a top name in baby and toddler toys for ages six months to three years
Has colorful components with different activities to keep kids occupied, and helps them develop dexterity and hand/eye coordination
cons: Not all youngsters showed interest in playing with it
Too heavy for very small kids to carry

customer_reviews.title: cool enough
customer_reviews.text: this is pretty interesting for a baby. i agree with other reviewers that the “knob” side could be a bit more thought out, and the purple side seems like they just ran out of ideas... but the other sides work well enough to entertain for a bit. it’s a bit heavy, so not too great for kids that aren’t sitting up unassisted yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Hill

customer_reviews.title: I really disliked this toy
customer_reviews.text: The cups don't really nest. They don't really stack. You have to force the pieces together with some real accuracy. The kind of accuracy that a 6 or even 24 month old do not really have. You can make the cups into balls... and that is nice. But again, it takes an adult hand to make them work. I was hoping for stacking cups that my kid would be able to work out size problem solving, but if you stack them smallest to largest, it is a weird balancing act. and to go largest to smallest like in the first picture, you have to force each cup onto the top of the other.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: 6 sides of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I might like this toy more than my baby boy! But he enjoys it, too. He likes to play with small things like buttons and zippers so I thought he may like to spin the yellow widgets, and I was right! That's his favorite side. I wish the green side was more of a joystick or did something, but it is easy for him to grasp and pick up the cube with. It's heavier than I thought, but he's 8 months and has no problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Doing

customer_reviews.title: This toy is a huge hit with my 9 month ...
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a huge hit with my 9 month old and the 2.5 year old will sometimes play with it !
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Ehh :/
customer_reviews.text: One side of the button doesnt move (the part that’s suppose to feel like a videoge joystick), and two of the wheels just spin and not click like the center one. One end just has ripples, and the kids could care less about that part.
customer_reviews.author: Huskey

customer_reviews.title: Provides little entertainment
customer_reviews.text: Cute and colorful, especially the jingle ball. While I do use these frequently for my son's physical therapy, I find them to only be helpful during that (grip strength with two halves at a time). We place the jingle ball inside of two halves to make a rattle which entertains him if we sit and roll it. However, age appropriateness is iffy as no baby can stack these because you need to use strength to lock them into place whether it be a tower or a ball, and same to disassemble.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: The palm of your hand
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure why this toy was on the recommended list of items for 9-month old babies. My daughter has not enjoyed this toy because it is, well, boring! It is super small too. It fits in the palm of my hand which was surprising because I thought it would be larger. It is not small enough to swallow though so do not worry. It is just not appealing.
customer_reviews.author: Roaringqueen

customer_reviews.title: Must have developmental toy for 8 month old
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have bought this sooner. My little one loves playing with it and I am amazed at what kind of development can ensue from one toy. Blocks lock when stacked from big to small, individual pieces then lock together to make 5 fun balls, or fit each ball within eachother to create one ball. Colors are vibrant and I also recognized small shapes on each piece that coordinates the fitting "pair." We also love to hide the rattle ball included and try to guess which piece it is hiding under.
customer_reviews.author: Ajo Lonzo

customer_reviews.title: Best simple toy that I have bought with endless possibilities for play!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my 7 month old as a Christmas gift for her to grow into playing and learning with. It was a great price at $7 for the toy! There seems to be endless possibilities for playing with this toy and I know she will enjoy it as she gets older. I saw a lot of reviews mentioning difficult getting the balls unclipped, so I was a little worried, however I have no issues at all! They clip together strong enough to stay together when rolled around but easy enough to unclip and stack! I'd say if you're on the fence to just buy it because it seems like a wonderful toy to learn and grow with your child!
customer_reviews.author: Kerstie

customer_reviews.title: Two Year Old Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some toys to keep my 2 year old occupied on a road trip. This is one of the toys that I got for him and he loves it! It kept him busy in the car for a while and he enjoys playing with it home as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie S

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: My 10-month old loves to spin and crank things so I knew he’d love this toy. I bought it for a vacation next week thinking it would be good for the car. Two of the sides don’t really do anything so there are basically two sides my son really likes. He loves the orange spinning circle and the three yellow gears. So far he really likes it and I’m hoping it will be a good toy for the car and the beach. There’s more potential for the sides that don’t do anything so I think it could be better but it’s a good toy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CaitM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toddler version
customer_reviews.text: We picked up two of these as gifts for a 1 and 3 year old who both love my husband’s fidget cube. This is a perfect toddler replacement, and even my husband has mentioned getting one for himself because it was fun to test out. Photo for size reference.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my one year olds birthday. She loves this. She's always playing with it. The only thing I don't like is that they're a little hard to snap together. Although they're hard to snap together for the one year old, my three year old can do it without any problems. The fact that they can turn into balls as well is also neat....but my kids love to throw them to get them to crack open and do it all over again. It gets super obnoxious and usually ends up with me confiscating them for a few hours. Kids love them but the constant throwing drives me insane
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer F.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps little ones busy!
customer_reviews.text: All the balls stack together like nesting dolls, so it’s super easy to store and travel with. So fun to learn and play with colors by matching them to make balls, or stacking them to make towers. My LO is almost 14 months and she’s already figured out how to put the pieces together to make balls (only the smaller ones) Only downside is when it’s all nested together, kids won’t be able to take it apart because the outermost balls are really hard to unhook, but it’s good because it keeps them from falling apart all over the place. So overall it’s an Awesome toy. Keeps my kid busy for at least 30 min, of not more sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great for fine motor movement
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this toy for a week and my 9 month old daughter loves it. She isn’t much for noisy toys with flashing lights, she has to have something to do, pieces to move herself and things to figure out. This is perfect for her and decent size that it won’t get lost. Would definitely recommend this toy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Coley

customer_reviews.title: Very mehhh fidget cube Great rainbow stack
customer_reviews.text: We will see how this goes.. upon my inspection this toy seems very basic and plain.. the rotary wheel doesn't make noise.. the gears only one makes noise when you turn it.. the green nob does what exactly?.. Will updates when I see my son play with this 2nd toy purchased was the stackable rainbow.. turns into balls you can play small toy hide And seek w them.. son finds this toy interesting so far
customer_reviews.author: ladydragon

customer_reviews.title: There are probably better options to buy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: keeps baby interested, versatile, cute and colorful, helps babies learn, not easily damaged Cons: When stacked, the numbers read bottom to top instead of top to bottom. Although the number 1 is smaller than the number 10. The "cup" for the number 10 is smaller. The numbers aren't highlighted as the picture online indicates so they are a little hard to see. Hard for babies to lock and unlock
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4 sides are good, 2 are boring
customer_reviews.text: Very big, sides are about 5 inches long. It will be hard for a baby under 7 or so months to hold. Also, it 4 of the sides are interactive. 1 side is just a knob that doesn't move, and 1 is just some ridged that also don't move. My daughter likes the spinner/dial (kind of like an old phone), and the gears that click and spin. The switch she took longer to figure out, as well as the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: David Z.

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES these! It's so versatile to stack or push into ball shapes. He especially loves the yellow ball that has a bell inside. He throws that thing around like crazy! I can't wait for when he's older and can be more creative with this toy. For now he loves playing hide and seek with the ball by placing it inside a ball shape. He also loves stacking and toppling the tower over!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple but perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They are so simple but my (almost) 4-month-old baby is so enthralled with them. She obviously can't stack them by herself yet, but she loves knocking over the tower and playing with them when they are cupped inside one another. When she's playing with them she gets a look of concentration on her face that I've rarely seen with anything else. It's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: JCL25

customer_reviews.title: One of the sides doesn't do anything
customer_reviews.text: The side that's supposed to be a joystick doesn't move - it's just a plastic joystick that juts out. The wheel side also spins without much resistance/a bit loosely. The side with the buttons and ball bearing is fine but the ball bearing doesn't spin. It's a good imitation of a real fidget cube but all the sides are not as engaging as a real fidget cube.
customer_reviews.author: Vina Y

customer_reviews.title: Just no
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure what these people are reviewing for a baby. I got this for my nephew for his first Christmas and I will be donating it to a shelter for a kid slightly older? This thing is hard. If a baby hits themself or throws it- it’s going to hurt. Also ... no lights no sounds and not all sides are functional. Really disappointed- save your $5
customer_reviews.author: Amber Beach

customer_reviews.title: Great toy package!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (1.5 years) loves these toys.. she likes pulling them apart and connecting them into balls. Great to hide scarves in & have them pull things out of the holes. Plenty of fun things to do. The small yellow ball turned into more of a dog toy but she’s likes shaking it & throwing it around (there’s a bead inside to make it rattle) and the cube has some cool features for toddlers to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Ck_M

customer_reviews.title: So many ways to play with this!
customer_reviews.text: This stacking toy is a favorite in our house. There are so many different ways to play with it. My daughter is 18 months old now and we play with this several times a day. She likes to stack them, nest them, make balls with them, and twist them side to side in he carpet to make little circles. They are also fun for looking through, covering ears, and wearing as hats. Just so many different ways to play with this! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Catra121

customer_reviews.title: Can't take the heat
customer_reviews.text: I put these is our steamer, that is made for steaming bottles, and they almost melted. They became soft, then deformed, then held that deformed shape once they cooled, so that they are either difficult to snap together, or they won't snap together at all. Seems odd that these can't take a simple steam sterilization without being ruined. How many parents out there wash and sterilize everything before giving it to their children?
customer_reviews.author: DIY

customer_reviews.title: Losing stackability with prolonged use
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, my daughter likes to play with the yellow ball and it has cool features such as being transformable to a ball when you combine 2 of them together. However, after using them for a few weeks, we noticed that the stacking part has become looser and looser. It is not the best plastic in terms of durability. Hopefully, this does not become worse in a month.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Shin

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept but these aren't as good as I had hoped. If you put them together , one ball inside the other they are hard to get apart, which is the whole idea. I try to put them together loosely so my granddaughter can get them apart. They are made of a hard plastic, not a rubbery type. I don't think they will hold up that well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Catroppa

customer_reviews.title: Simply Perfect Toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy couldn't be more simple and perfect. This is my THIRD time purchasing it, the first time for my own son and I've given it as a gift to two other children now as well. That's just how much I love it's versatility. It nests, it stacks, it can be made into different sized balls, it can help teach color recognition and counting as your baby grows, and they can be used for pretend play as bowls or hats. My 2.5 still enjoys playing with it. He likes putting them together to make balls with small toys he has placed inside, and giving everyone different sized/colored "hats".
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Definitely buy this for your little one
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for small hands. My son recieved this when he was one. It engaged him with the different textures and buttons. I agree with the other reviews that a couple of the sides could be better. Even if it isn't perfect, for the price its worth buying. Great for the diaper bag!
customer_reviews.author: momknows

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy! Fast shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Crazy fast shipping! I love this toy, I've been playing with it all night. Each side is enjoyable. Some reviews complain about the weird purple side being "boring" but with autistic children this side is a sensory texture side that stimulates their little brains. It's durable and can handle being thrown around and too big to choke on. Can't wait to give this toy to little man, I know he will love it.
customer_reviews.author: bucketsof blood

customer_reviews.title: Best baby toy - hands down!
customer_reviews.text: This is such an awesome stacking toy! They don’t just stack, they also nest, and you can also connect them together to make balls. The little yellow ball is “shaky”, and can go in the middle of a ball to make it more fun, or you can hide it under a cup and then find it. The possibilities seem endless! Definitely a GREAT toy to have and to give!!
customer_reviews.author: Josiepie

customer_reviews.title: Good Distraction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before going on a long road trip with our 15-month old. This was a good distraction - kept her interest for 10-15 minutes, which is a long time for that age. She likes the red switch, yellow wheel things, orange wheel and purple buttons. The green knob is kind of pointless. The only downside is that it makes for a solid weapon when she gets bored and chucks it.
customer_reviews.author: EMorris

customer_reviews.title: Pile won’t stack good
customer_reviews.text: Usually we love all Fisher Price toys, but this one is a miss. The bowls wont stack good together, the pile keeps falling, and the little yellow ball is always rolling far away abd underneath things. It closes into balls, but they are too difficult for babies to grab. Its not a good one.
customer_reviews.author: JeremyFeddersen

customer_reviews.title: defective
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately, I bought this toy as a birthday gift, the child just opened it and he is unable to separate the layers of the balls, even after lining up the numbers. I would absolutely not recommend this product. it is too frustrating for a child.
customer_reviews.author: mazz fdny

customer_reviews.title: Great concept
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old isn't into this much as a stacker yet but loves chewing on the peices and shaking them when they are on ball form with the tiny ball stuck inside. I love that these have many different functions and uses and she will eventually be able to stack, sort, etc. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: akaMomTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Not for us.
customer_reviews.text: If your kid likes stacking cups, these are not the same. My daughter has yet to show any interest in these. The balls on top also just sits there. It serves no purpose. Actual stacking cups are cheaper and a better investment in my opinion. They click together like this, but no baby that enjoys stacking (the reason you get these) could click these together themselves. We did not enjoy this and I wouldn't recommend this over traditional stacking cups!
customer_reviews.author: Ian Littlepage

customer_reviews.title: Best stacking set
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves these - chasing the yellow ball, stacking and unstacking the bowls, and rubbing them on the ground To create the most annoying sound possible. Aka in his mind they’re the best toy around! The yellow ball was actually what motivated him to start crawling and he loves chasing it around the room.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: We love this!! I bought it because I thought it was so funny, I use a fidget cube a lot to help with anxiety so this just made me happy. But my baby seriously loves this toy! I can give it to him in the car and he is entertained while we drive to where ever we are going. If it is in the floor and he sees it he will crawl right over to it to play with it!
customer_reviews.author: Emilia

customer_reviews.title: Genius
customer_reviews.text: Any two consecutive hemispheres turn into a ball. All the balls can be nested. The cups can be stacked convex or concave. Any two cups can be sturdily stacked, not just consecutive ones. Comes with numbers and colors. And a little jangly ball that will roll all over the floor for a clumsy baby to swat and chase. I LOVE THIS TOY! I play with it as much as baby does.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy H.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy toy
customer_reviews.text: This has lasted through three grandchildren- they love how each color and size fits into one another and then they take it apart all over again to get the gingly ball inside. Only reason for 4 stars is that it can be hard to take the layers off sometimes and the kids need help.
customer_reviews.author: Canyon 92587

customer_reviews.title: Great little nic-nac for a little one
customer_reviews.text: Our 9 month old enjoys this a decent bit. Not his favorite toy, but definitely something of passing interest, with a number of different tactile sensations and skills to explore. For the price, you can't beat this as a great toy to put in your cycle.
customer_reviews.author: The DenTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: What this green button for?
customer_reviews.text: Good this toy doesn't cost much, otherwise I would be really disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Lidia D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter received this for Christmas when she was about 6 months old. A year later, she still plays with them daily, & now we're using them to learn her colors. They're versatile, since you can stack them in a tower, or put 2 together into a sphere. She loves to hide other things in them, or we use them as bowls & pick up other things of each color to put in the "bowl." Great gift that grows with a little one!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Never too old to play with stacking toys!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great basic toy. Got this for a friends 2 year old thinking he might be way beyond wanting to play with it but he loves stacking, building & the usual little boy stuff. They sent a little video of him playing with this toy & he was having a ball. Never too old to stack & toss now & then. Parents were happy to have something simple & reliable in their supply of fun items.
customer_reviews.author: Sue B.

customer_reviews.title: No potential here. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: It's a boring toy. Kids will loose intrest within minutes. Makes no noise. Dont see any learning potential. I think it's a waste of money. And maybe all the reviews are fake giving it a high rating. The product video implies the objects make sound.SMH!
customer_reviews.author: LACRYSTAL W.

customer_reviews.title: If you have multiple kids, buy two!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my baby but her 10yr old sister and 7 yr old brother keep taking off with it. Everyone saying some sides are pointless obviously don't have an imagination. My 6 month old loves making noise with the indented part and trying to get the joystick off. Perfect car toy.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Decent little toy for the price. It’s the perfect size for babies to hold, but I was expecting it to be a little more exciting. The “joystick” is just a stationary rubber knob that doesn’t interest my baby at all, and the side with the texture to rub is also non-interesting. So really only 4 sides that are fun to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Allison C.

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to disassemble
customer_reviews.text: I want to love that stacking toy but I always get stuck with disassembling the pieces when I want to play with those. If I can't do it, how can my child play on her own with that toy? We have to use a knife to disassemble the pieces... Not sure if I got a defective one, but not happy with that toy. Other than that, the idea was great!
customer_reviews.author: Drenn

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to separate in nesting mode.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my 9 month old grandaughter, but my 3 year old grandson loves it also and is playing with it a lot. The problem we have with it is using it as a nesting toy connecting all balls inside each other. Once together it is nearly impossible for even an adult to pull them back apart. They click so tightly. And a child DEFINITELY can't get it apart. I had to pry apart with a butter knife..
customer_reviews.author: kimberly b

customer_reviews.title: Not for a 15 month old
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the fantastic reviews. They are cute but way too difficult for a 15 a month old to secure together when stacking. The manufacturer’s description says 6 months and up yet this is more appropriate for a child older than 15 months.
customer_reviews.author: VIRGO78

customer_reviews.title: Not obsessed
customer_reviews.text: Bought because of the great reviews but I’m not obsessed with this. Feels really cheap, cups don’t stack together without snapping, and the snapping is really hard to do on some of them. Wanted a good stacking toy for my baby and this totally fell short.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not great for us
customer_reviews.text: Not very impressed with this toy. Reviews and ratings for this were misleading. I was hoping this would help entertain a baby on a plane, but it is bulky for an item that does not have a lot of exciting features. It has a few “fidget” type activities (buttons etc) but could be done much better. Feels like a piece of plastic junk we will outgrow in a day or two. I would recommend a Quiet Activity book or a Dimpl toy over this one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: 1 year old loves it .
customer_reviews.text: Dont even know what I was think when I ordered it but 1 year old just loves it . It literally does nothing but spin the 3 little dials. No noise or lights or anything but my daughter just loves it . So for that reason 5 stars .
customer_reviews.author: Ray Ray

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this toy he has had it for a couple of months. He was 7 months when I got for him and he still plays with it. Glad it’s engaging and helps motor skills, two sides seem pointless one is a circle raised up and another side where it’s lots of indented lines. Weird but love the product
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Liked the old version better
customer_reviews.text: We had an older version of this but one of the cups got broken so we got a new set. Unfortunately they have redesigned something. These bowls are extremely difficult to take apart. I really have to fight to get them open. I can't imagine how frustrating it will be for my learning infant.
customer_reviews.author: cate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for busy hands!
customer_reviews.text: This cube is a great sensory delight for babies to experience what fingers can do! Its not too heavy, with just enough bulk to hold easily with two hands. Colorful with each side having different degrees of awakening the senses for a baby’s small fingers to seek and find
customer_reviews.author: 2xSurvivor

customer_reviews.title: Dont hesitate to buy it. Its a great toy.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh Kyson loves this toy. He stacks them & knocks them down. He plays peekaboo with half of it. They snap together & put the ball in side. He uses them to bang on the table. He just loves carrying them around. It is very good toy for a toddler, I am so glad I bought it for him.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: simple and entertaining
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these stackable cups! This is especially useful to keep him entertained when my elderly mom comes to watch him and she can't walk around as much. He actually sits on the couch with these and will play with them for extended periods of time. He's 14 months and right now he really enjoys putting two cups together to turn them into a ball, as well as placing other items inside the cups. Also, they are easy to organize because they are numbered on the side and it's easy to tell if you're missing one. Simple toy, but very much enjoyed by my toddler.
customer_reviews.author: RiL

customer_reviews.title: So fun!  So versatile!!!
customer_reviews.text: These little stacking cups are deceptively simple and don't look like much, but they are SO many toys in one - and for under $10!! We use them to stack, make balls & roll, hide small objects under to play peek-a-boo, to peek through the little holes and look at each other/stuff, to sort objects into - i.e. purple objects into the purple cup, etc. We also put stuff inside them and then roll them. My son finds the different noises that different objects make inside them oh so exciting. I find that these are one of my favorite toys to play with him. Simple. Open ended yet they also stack and form balls securely. Great for interactive floor play!!
customer_reviews.author: AQBoston

customer_reviews.title: Too big and not too exciting
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. It's larger than necessary and thus hard to fit in a purse, and the buttons, etc., didn't entertain my 15-month old on a cross-country plane trip. I ended up giving it away.
customer_reviews.author: Nanci Dru

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and fun!
customer_reviews.text: A favorite from when our daughters were babies 11 years ago—so glad to be able to purchase another set for baby boy! Such a versatile toy—we love that it can be stacked, nested, made into multiple balls, is numbered and in rainbow order. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Susanna H. Pippel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My children absolutely loved these when they were younger. I have purchased more for the day that I have grandchildren or other littles around. They are versatile and help children with creativity and imagination.
customer_reviews.author: AprilR83

customer_reviews.title: Lots of different ways to play
customer_reviews.text: Our son enjoys this toy, mostly the jingle ball. The bowls don't stack without clicking , which is what I was looking for but they do click together to make the tower. Our 9 month old can't do this but he enjoys hitting the tower around and his big sister loves clicking the different bowls together for him. Another neat feature was that the bowls can snap together to make balls. We put the jingle ball into the bowl ball and it's another toy. We also use them in the bath, they have a hole in them middle of each bowl, so they work great. Lots of different ways to play.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Toy for Price
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good toy for the price. No complaints about the quality or value. My toddler has never favored the fidget cube over other things, but it’s great for travel or a short distraction if he’s in a high chair ( before it’s thrown on the floor).
customer_reviews.author: Victor Bachand

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy for little babies
customer_reviews.text: My baby girl (10 months) loves to play with this toy but it is heavy for her. Once it fell on my foot and it hurts really bad so I can only imagine what could have happened to my little one.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Carvajal

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, simple toy for little ones
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, simple toy for little ones. We had this when our kids were little, enjoyed hours of attaching and nesting. It even entertained my husband and I, funny how things like this can dothat. I purchased this for my mom to have at her house for me niece (my mom even enjoyed the original set that much). The one we got this time has two of the half spheres that fit a bit too tightly, they are hard to get apart. My husband is the only one that can pretty then apart. It was disappointing as the original set was so great.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hamele

customer_reviews.title: A good toy.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 2 year old for car rides. He likes it. It keeps him entertained for a little while. Even when I pick it up and fidget with it, it’s pretty fun. It’s really durable.
customer_reviews.author: J. J.

customer_reviews.title: Beloved Car Toy
customer_reviews.text: This was a great road trip toy for my 16-month old! He particularly liked the side that works like a light switch, and the spinning wheel. Unfortunately, as it doesn’t have any way to attach a string, it also made for a great projectile when he was done with it 😆
customer_reviews.author: tsaranger

customer_reviews.title: Hard for kids to take apart
customer_reviews.text: I hate this toy. I thought it would be a great alternative to the traditional stacking tower but it is so hard to get apart. Crazy durable and doesn't come apart when thrown, but it's frustrating bfor the kids to try to open.
customer_reviews.author: taydiann

customer_reviews.title: Boring boring
customer_reviews.text: My 20 month old played with it for 2 mins, looked at me and got bored and pushed it to the side. It is boring! Purchased it based on reviews and to help w sensory and other skills and nope 👎🏻 waste of money and time. It was boring even for me.
customer_reviews.author: Minè

customer_reviews.title: keeps baby busy
customer_reviews.text: a nice toy to take as distraction during a car ride or doctor wait. my 15mo old likes all kinds of switches and wheels, he seems to enjoy the toy. rather sturdy also, he drops it all the time and it still lives.
customer_reviews.author: Irina Williams

customer_reviews.title: 5 Month old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this toy! She is 5 months old and thinks it is the greatest thing to flip and roll. We use this a lot during tummy time. I think it could be more entertaining, it doesn't have noise or lights...but I guess that is something I should be thankful for.
customer_reviews.author: M&B

customer_reviews.title: Versatile play
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these. Super fun and lots of ways to play with them. My son is 2 years old (26) months. He likes to put random stuff inside of the balls and have me open them.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say but it’s a stupid toy. No music. Nothing pops. Very boring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy
customer_reviews.text: Fun baby toy. My son loves playing with this. Kind of on the heavy side for a baby toy. My son picks it up and over his head and has dropped it on his head before which he didn’t like.
customer_reviews.author: Em S

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I am a physical therapist and bought this for my little one to develop his stacking skills. The quality of the plastic and colors are great, but functionally it is a terrible toy! It is difficult to get these to stack even as an adult and they very easily slide off one another. We use them mostly as balls (they click together) and I have pinched the crap out of tiny skin folds more times than I can count, which makes me doubt it will be a good toy for our 10 mo even as he gains dexterity. Would not buy again or recommend. Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Tiedemann

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are actually really fun and versatile. You can make several balls, the little smiley face can be put inside a ball to make a rattle, and you can make a few different stack configurations. They’re my favorite go-to toddler toy.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this for my granddaughter for her birthday. Had a grandson that had this toy several years back and he played and played with it. Makes a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs a stand.
customer_reviews.text: I love the product, but wish it came with a stand. The stackable idea is great but I can see little ones getting frustrated because of placing one on top and they fall.
customer_reviews.author: Winkie

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old grandson carries one of the purple around in his hand even when he plays with other toys. They stack well. They make balls to roll if you match up the halves. Just an all around fun toy.
customer_reviews.author: moviemom78729

customer_reviews.title: Best stacking cups ever
customer_reviews.text: This brings stacking cups to a whole new level.. These can be stacked soo many different ways making it a fun activity for the parents and child..the top is a smiley face rattle too.. easy for the child to grasp.. A++
customer_reviews.author: Oregonmommy3

customer_reviews.title: Great educational stacking toy!
customer_reviews.text: 14 month old grandson loves this toy. Educational and versatile. Teaches child stacking skills, plus each color can be made into a ball. Pieces have numbers for additional learning.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: ABA Therapist....Perfect Toy to teach so many things
customer_reviews.text: As an ABA Therapist for young toddlers, I use this EVERY SINGLE DAY during my sessions. My baby clients LOVE IT. There soooo much you can do with it, besides putting them in number and color order. you can put the similar colors (blues) (greens) together and form a ball. You can put the happy little ball inside and make noises, you can also form the balls and put them into sizes (big-small). Just too many things you can teacher your child with this. They also seem very durable since my kids have thrown this toy up and down and they are still in perfect condition. =D
customer_reviews.author: Diannes Escano

customer_reviews.title: Pull apart easily as a ball
customer_reviews.text: These are to stack, and then pull apart. You can also take two and clamp together making a ball. Some sizes don't clamp very tightly together forming a ball therefore pull apart easily.
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: This is a great toy I take on home visits with my special ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy I take on home visits with my special needs children. It closes into a ball with the yellow ball inside and you can roll it back and forth. It is multi-functional. It is definitely worth the money and it's always one of the first/ favorite in my "toy bag".
customer_reviews.author: blueblackmolly

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come in giftable packaging
customer_reviews.text: They came in plastic bags, nothing attached and no box to gift in. I don't know if I'm going to be able to gift it to a 9 month old. Now it does seem to have the Fisher Price quality and sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Valfreya

customer_reviews.title: Work well for bath toys
customer_reviews.text: I use these for bath toys, and they're wonderful. Perfect because there are no places where water can get trapped and cause mold to form. Easy to clean. Fascinating for my 10 month old.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old loves this! We’ve brought it on trips as a distraction for the car seat. It is not a toy I would usually buy for my kiddo, but he really does focus and work on each of the little gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel North

customer_reviews.title: Long Play Life
customer_reviews.text: This has easily been my son’s favorite toy since we bought it! Got it at six months, he’s now two and still pulls it out on a regular basis. He’s found different ways to play as he’s aged, from knocking down, to stacking, or assembling the balls himself. His current favorite activities include getting all the balls to spin at the same time, and putting random things inside the balls and shaking or spinning them. All the parts look just as good as the day we bought, and that’s with my son throwing the stack on the floor with great force to separate everything. You won’t regret this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy with many uses
customer_reviews.text: Had this for each of my kids. This can be used up learn how to stack in size order and number order, to learn colors and can be interlocked to make numerous sized balls to help with OT skills. Very worth it
customer_reviews.author: BusyBee

customer_reviews.title: Fidgeting Fun
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful gift for my grandson. Now that he is sitting up he is entertained with the sounds, colors and many touchable things on the cube.
customer_reviews.author: huggie

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: The grandsons love these! So versatile with all the options. Kids can learn colors, sorting, stacking, nesting, coordination and patience.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Carol

customer_reviews.title: Fun and different way to play with stacking and nesting.
customer_reviews.text: This toy is fun and provides a different way of playing with stacking and nesting. The bowls also connect to become balls, so you can nest the different sizes of balls.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Ideal road trip toy
customer_reviews.text: One year old used this multiple times on a road trip to Yellowstone. It didn’t hold her interest for an excessive amount of time, but what does? When she’d start to fuss I’d turn it and use the new side and that helped her get back into it.
customer_reviews.author: Attigus

customer_reviews.title: Cute idea, nice for gifting
customer_reviews.text: I got my toddler this for Christmas. One of the sides (I believe meant to be like the thumb joystick on an xbox controller) doesn't move enough to really feel like it is a fidget. The other sides are great, though, and she seems to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple but entertaining
customer_reviews.text: A friend sent this to my daughter for her 1st birthday. I didn't think she'd like it since the age states 6 months + and it seemed so basic, but I was definitely wrong. My daughter is now 16 months old and this is still her favorite toy. It's amazing how much fun she has stacking and unstacking the bowls, hitting them together, looking through the little holes, and balancing them on her head. It's a basic toy, but it's definitely entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Baby's favorite!
customer_reviews.text: These are one of my baby's favorite toys! He is 11 months now and still super amused by them. So much you can do with them too. Stack them, knock them down, hide the ball under one, put them together to form balls, or just bang them together!
customer_reviews.author: Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Super versatile, she'll play with these for years!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these cups for our 6 month old daughter. I cannot say enough about them. They're fun for stacking, teaching colors and numbers. We use the cups as bowls to put the ball in, or we create balls from the cups and hide the small jingly ball in them. She sits up to quietly stack and unstack the cups, or we click them into balls and she rolls all over the floor with them. They're great for encouraging your baby to crawl. She watches us stack them in absolute awe. This is one toy that I think she will play with for years, and it's such a nice contrast from all those noisy, battery powered toys out there.
customer_reviews.author: Snegae

customer_reviews.title: Car entertainment!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 21 month old grandson. He can go on tippy-toe and reach the light switch and keeps turning the lights off and on. He is a button pusher! This cube lets him do the activities he enjoys! Really entertains him in the car or in a restaurant waiting for food arrival!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Krol

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my son for Christmas who is 10 months old. For being called stacking cups and the picture shown, I thought these would be great. Unfortunately these are horrible. The plastic is slick and the cups slide around making it impossible to stack. I find it difficult to do which makes it impossible for my little guy. When you go to stack the cups, they just slide off. He loves stacking things so it's such a shame this toy did not work. The face ball is cute and my son enjoys playing with that piece. I just wish these were better stackers.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

product_meta.title: Fisher-Price My First Fidget Cube
product_meta.description: Style:Fidget Cube​From colorful clickers to spinning rollers, a toggle switch and more, this cube is loaded with exciting activities for tiny fingers to explore! With six sides of unique fine motor skill-boosting play and a variety of colors and textures, this activity block will keep your little one busy as a bee! Where development comes into play Fine Motor: Little hands can strengthen dexterity by grasping the block and pressing, spinning or pushing the different activities. Sensory: All that clicking, spinning, and exploring will engage and excite your baby's developing tactile and auditory senses! Curiosity & Wonder: Little ones are introduced to cause & effect as they toggle and push to hear clicking sounds.
feature_bullets: ​6 sides of play, each with a unique activity!
​Sized just right for baby to grasp & explore
A variety of activities, textures, colors & sounds excite baby's senses​

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,865 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
